intro: Seseli libanotis f. callayi, commonly known as the Lebanon bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in alpine and subalpine environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a distinctive, bell-shaped appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
